definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: He constantly advertised for hired hands.
sentences.chinese: 他經常貼廣告僱傭人手。

sentences.english: They only let me out on patrol when they're shorthanded .
sentences.chinese: 很多人這個月休假中，所以我們有一點人手短缺。

sentences.english: Do companies really want to change this picture by hiring people and paying them and stuff?
sentences.chinese: 企業真的想增僱人手，改變這種狀況嗎？

sentences.english: Mother needs extra help in the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 媽媽需要額外的人手幫廚。

sentences.english: For the increase of employees and equipment, the production dispatch department.
sentences.chinese: 關於設備人手，生產調度部做個計劃交給財務部審覈。

sentences.english: We are always shorthanded on Sundays.
sentences.chinese: 我們總是在星期天缺人手。

sentences.english: The students each have a new book.
He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool cutteth off the feet, and drinketh damage.
sentences.chinese: 藉愚昧人手寄的，是砍斷自己的腳，自受損害。

sentences.english: But playing against an outmanned opponent, it didn't matter.
sentences.chinese: 但是和人手不足的對手打球這沒有關係。

sentences.english: They each have a copy of every book published in Britain.
sentences.chinese: 他們人手一冊每本書在英國出版。

sentences.english: Outgunned, outnumbered, but now fighting back.
What do you look for when You hire people?
sentences.chinese: 當你招聘人手的時候你需要什麼類型的？

sentences.english: We live in a world that can and does overwhelm many people.
sentences.chinese: 現實世界確實使許多人手無足措。

sentences.english: We need some more men to turn the ship around.
sentences.chinese: 我們需增派更多的人手使這艘船卸貨返航。

sentences.english: We’re going to need more manpower if we’re to finish this by morning.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們想在早上完成這個工作就需要更多的人手。

definition: to stay behind to take care of things
as far as I know/to the best of my knowledge
